trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Net.WebClient.UploadProgressChanged"></xref> event of a <xref href="System.Net.WebClient"></xref>.
Instances of this class are passed to the <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventHandler>.
Gets the number of bytes received.
Uploading data to a server may result in a download from the server.
For example, suppose your application uploads a POST request to a Web server.
The resulting download will update <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesReceived%2A> and <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.TotalBytesToReceive%2A>.
To determine what percentage of the transfer has occurred, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> property.
When the upload is complete, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 50%.
When the download completes, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 100%.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that indicates the number of bytes received.
Gets the number of bytes sent.
Uploading data to a server may result in a download from the server.
For example, suppose your application uploads a POST request to a Web server.
The resulting download will update <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesReceived%2A> and <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.TotalBytesToReceive%2A>.
To determine what percentage of the transfer has occurred, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> property.
When the upload is complete, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 50%.
When the download completes, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 100%.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that indicates the number of bytes sent.
Gets the total number of bytes in a <xref href="System.Net.WebClient"></xref> data upload operation.
To determine the number of bytes already received, use the <xref:System.Net.DownloadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesReceived%2A> property.
Uploading data to a server may result in a download from the server.
For example, suppose your application uploads a POST request to a Web server.
The resulting download will update <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesReceived%2A> and <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.TotalBytesToReceive%2A>.
To determine what percentage of the transfer has occurred, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> property.
When the upload is complete, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 50%.
When the download completes, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 100%.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that indicates the number of bytes that will be received.
Gets the total number of bytes to send.
To determine the number of bytes already sent, use the <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesSent%2A> property.
Uploading data to a server may result in a download from the server.
For example, suppose your application uploads a POST request to a Web server.
The resulting download will update <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.BytesReceived%2A> and <xref:System.Net.UploadProgressChangedEventArgs.TotalBytesToReceive%2A>.
To determine what percentage of the transfer has occurred, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> property.
When the upload is complete, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 50%.
When the download completes, <xref:System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs.ProgressPercentage%2A> will be 100%.
An <xref href="System.Int64"></xref> value that indicates the number of bytes that will be sent.
